com.airg.android.device

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.airg.android.device.Device

  • public class Device
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides common answers about the device. This class can be used both as an instance or static methods. Instance methods just relay to static methods so any performance difference between the methods should be negligible.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • hardwareId

        public static java.lang.String hardwareId(android.content.Context context)
        Get the unique Android ID value. Please do not use this method to obtain an advertising id.
        Parameters:
        context - to access the device settings
        Returns:
        The android ID

      • getSystemService

        public static <T> T getSystemService(android.content.Context context,
                                     java.lang.String name)
        Obtain a handle to a system service
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the service (e.g. ConnectivityManager, WindowManager, etc.).
        Parameters:
        context - active context
        name - name of the desired service
        Returns:
        The requested system service or null if no such service exists.

      • getSystemService

        public <T> T getSystemService(java.lang.String name)
        See getSystemService(Context, String)

      • getSystemService

        public static <T> T getSystemService(android.content.Context context,
                                     java.lang.Class<T> tClass)
        Obtain a handle to a system service. This method requires an API level of at least 23 (Marshmallow)
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the service (e.g. ConnectivityManager, WindowManager, etc.).
        Parameters:
        context - active context
        tClass - service class type
        Returns:
        The matching system service or null if no such service exists.

        See getSystemService(Context, Class)

      • hasSystemFeature

        public static boolean hasSystemFeature(android.content.Context context,
                                       java.lang.String feature)
        Queries for a specific system feature
        Parameters:
        context - active context
        feature - name of the desired feature (e.g. PackageManager.FEATURE_BLUETOOTH, PackageManager.FEATURE_CAMERA_FLASH, etc. ).
        Returns:
        true if the feature is supported and false otherwise

      • hasSystemFeature

        public boolean hasSystemFeature(java.lang.String feature)
        See hasSystemFeature(Context, String)

      • hasSystemFeature

        public static boolean hasSystemFeature(android.content.Context context,
                                       java.lang.String feature,
                                       int version)
        Queries for a specific version of a system feature. This method is only available on Android Nougat (24) and above.
        Parameters:
        context - active context
        feature - name of the desired feature (e.g. PackageManager.FEATURE_BLUETOOTH, PackageManager.FEATURE_CAMERA_FLASH, etc. ).
        version - required version
        Returns:
        true if the feature is supported and the available version is greater than or equal to requested version; false otherwise.

      • hasSystemFeature

        public boolean hasSystemFeature(java.lang.String feature,
                                int version)
        See hasSystemFeature(Context, String, int)

      • getSystemFeatureVersion

        public static int getSystemFeatureVersion(android.content.Context context,
                                          java.lang.String feature)
        Query the available version of the specified feature. Note: Feature versions are not available prior to api 24 (Nougat). This method returns VERSION_NONE under API levels lower than 24.
        Parameters:
        context - active context
        feature - feature name to query
        Returns:
        Available feature version, if the feature is supported; VERSION_NONE otherwise.

      • getSystemFeatureVersion

        public int getSystemFeatureVersion(java.lang.String feature)
        See getSystemFeatureVersion(Context, String)

      • hasAllSystemFeatures

        public static boolean hasAllSystemFeatures(android.content.Context context,
                                           java.lang.String... features)
        Does the device support all of the specified features
        Parameters:
        context - active context
        features - list of features to query
        Returns:
        true if and only if all of the specified features are supported
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the features parameter is null or empty

      • hasAllSystemFeatures

        public boolean hasAllSystemFeatures(java.lang.String... features)
        See hasAllSystemFeatures(Context, String...)

      • hasAnySystemFeatures

        public static boolean hasAnySystemFeatures(android.content.Context context,
                                           java.lang.String... features)
        Does the device support any of the specified features
        Parameters:
        context - active context
        features - list of features to query
        Returns:
        true if and only if any of the specified features are supported (i.e. at least one of the queried features is supported)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the features parameter is null or empty

      • hasAnySystemFeatures

        public boolean hasAnySystemFeatures(java.lang.String... features)
        See hasAnySystemFeatures(Context, String...)

      • getLocale

        public java.util.Locale getLocale()
        See getLocale(Context)

      • getLayoutDirection

        public static int getLayoutDirection(android.content.Context context)
        Current layout direction of the device. This method returns View.LAYOUT_DIRECTION_LTR (0) if the runtime SDK version is below JELLY_BEAN_MR1 (android-17)
        Parameters:
        context - context through which to access configuration
        Returns:
        View.LAYOUT_DIRECTION_LTR if the layout direction is left-to-right (or api < android-17), View.LAYOUT_DIRECTION_RTL otherwise.

      • getLayoutDirection

        public int getLayoutDirection()
        see getLayoutDirection(Context)

      • getScreenOrientation

        public static int getScreenOrientation(android.content.Context context)
        Get the screen orientation
        Parameters:
        context - context through which to access configuration
        Returns:
        current screen orientation, either Configuration.ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE or Configuration.ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT

      • getScreenSize

        public static int[] getScreenSize(android.content.Context context)
        Gets the screen size in pixels
        Parameters:
        context - Context through which to access configuration
        Returns:
        the screen size in pixels as an array of int with the width at index SIZE_WIDTH and height at SIZE_HEIGHT

      • getScreenSize

        public int[] getScreenSize()
        See getScreenSize(Context)

      • getScreenSizeDP

        public static int[] getScreenSizeDP(android.content.Context context)
        Get the screen size in device independent pixels (dp)
        Parameters:
        context - Context through which to access configuration
        Returns:
        the screen size in dp as an array of int with the width at index SIZE_WIDTH and height at SIZE_HEIGHT

      • getMobileCountryCode

        public static int getMobileCountryCode(android.content.Context context)
        Gets the IMSI MCC (mobile country code) for the current device. Since this value cannot change without a reboot, it is cached so there's no performance penalty for calling this method repeatedly.
        Parameters:
        context - Context through which to access configuration
        Returns:
        mcc

      • getMobileCountryCode

        public int getMobileCountryCode()
        See getMobileCountryCode(Context)

      • getMobileNetworkCode

        public static int getMobileNetworkCode(android.content.Context context)
        Gets the IMSI MNC (mobile network code) for the current device. Since this value cannot change without a reboot, it is cached so there's no performance penalty for calling this method repeatedly.
        Parameters:
        context - Context through which to access configuration
        Returns:
        mnc

      • getMobileNetworkCode

        public int getMobileNetworkCode()
        See getMobileNetworkCode(Context)
